thread.title: World Tourism Day sees travel bloggers share their top holiday snaps
thread.title_full: World Tourism Day sees travel bloggers share their top holiday snaps | Daily Mail Online

author: Caroline Mcguire for MailOnline
title: World Tourism Day sees travel bloggers share their top holiday snaps
text:
View
comments
A new internet craze sparked by World Tourism Day shows no signs of abating.
Travel bloggers were asked to share their favourite holiday snaps on social media with the hashtag #helloworldrelay on Monday.
Sites including Instagram were inundated with tens of thousands of pictures and the interest doesn't appear to be slowing down, with bloggers still uploading their best photos.
The pictures provide a beautiful collection of images from around the world, from sunsets in Hawaii to mountain views in Oman, in a bid to inspire tourism and highlight the benefits of travel.
Other shutterbugs chose to focus on the exotic creatures from our oceans and jungles when showcasing their favourite spots around the globe.
MailOnline Travel has rounded up some of the best photos from the collection.
Travel bloggers have been sharing their favourite holiday pictures as part of a new internet craze called #helloworldrelay. They include this snap by travel photographer Elle Kirsten from the blog ThisIsYugen, who took this photo in Cappadocia, Turkey
This morning's colourful sunrise in @Tasmania made for a spectacular way to start World Tourism Day and @helloworldau's #helloworldRELAY! @lovethywalrus captured this beautiful shot from the top of Mt Wellington in #Hobart, and it's one of many inspiring shots from across Australia's states and territories that will be shared on #helloworldRELAY all day today. Follow along to see a diverse selection of experiences from across the country, and don't forget to share your own.
A photo posted by Australia (@australia) on Sep 26, 2015 at 7:04pm PDT
 2 Next Disappearing world: Pictured the crumbling village of... Dancing bears, daredevil motorbike stunts and shooting... I'm a big boy now! Heart-warming moment baby elephant thinks... I swear I could be on Mars! Oman is so different to any other destination I've been to, the mountains are so big yet so barren. The locals are so friendly, I was even offered a lift "south" whilst I was out shooting the sun mountains. We're heading west towards Nizwa as we speak, I've got my camera at the ready! @omantourismau #helloworldRELAY #oman
A photo posted by Lauren Bath (@laurenepbath) on Sep 27, 2015 at 12:07am PDT
{Hour twelve of twelve} And the sun goes down on @GoWhistler @WhistlerBlackcomb Mountain! What a day.. I didn't quite make all twelve today but will post the rest tomorrow.. Check out @sarahbtua in Tahiti who's now taking the relay baton from me and starting shooting sunrise. Hope you've enjoyed the @HelloworldAU #HelloWorldRELAY ride as much as I have! #OnlyInWhistler #360ofWB
